title: Imap
name: Imap
description:
Retrieves and deletes e-mail messages from a Imap mail server.
		This tag works exactly the same way as the cfmail tag. It has the same attributes.
		The Internet Message Access Protocol or IMAP is one of two of the most prevalent Internet standard protocols for e-mail retrieval,
		the other being POP3. Virtually all modern e-mail clients and servers support both protocols as a means of transferring e-mail messages from a server,
		such as those used by Gmail, to a client, such as Mozilla Thunderbird and Microsoft Outlook.
		Many implementations of webmail use IMAP to retrieve e-mail messages from a server and display them within a web browser,
		making the use of this protocol transparent to the user.

attributes.name: server
attributes.description: Host name biff.upperlip.com or IP address 192.1.2.225 of the Imap server.

attributes.name: uid
attributes.description: Specifies the unique ID or a comma-delimited list of Uids to retrieve or delete. If you set invalid Uids, then they are ignored.

attributes.name: port
attributes.description: Defaults to the standard Imap port, 143.

attributes.name: username
attributes.description: If no user name is specified, the Imap connection is anonymous.

attributes.name: password
attributes.description: Password that corresponds to user name.

attributes.name: messageNumber
attributes.description: Can be a comma-separated list of the message ids

attributes.name: attachmentPath
attributes.description:
Allows attachments to be written to the specified directory when action = "getAll". If an
		invalid attachmentPath is specified, no attachment files are written to the server.

attributes.name: timeout
attributes.description: Specifies the maximum time, in seconds, to wait for mail processing. Defaults is 60 seconds.

attributes.name: maxRows
attributes.description:
Sets the number of messages returned, starting with the number in the startRow attribute.
		This attribute is ignored if messageNumber is specified.

attributes.name: startRow
attributes.description:
Specifies the first row number to be retrieved. Default is 1. This attribute is ignored if
		messageNumber is specified.

attributes.name: debug
attributes.description: this attribute is deprecated and ignored, log control happens via the logging framwork directly.

attributes.name: generateUniqueFilenames
attributes.description:
Boolean indicating whether to generate unique filenames for the files attached to an e-mail
		message to avoid naming conflicts when the files are saved. Default is NO.
